title: SIGKDD Annual Progress Report

author: Gregory Piatetsky-Shapiro, KDnuggets
Jiawei Han, Department of Computer Science, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign

segmentation: Hello.
Bonjour.
I'm Gregory Peteski Sopeira, chair of CKDD, and in case in case you're wondering what is CKDD, it is the ACM Special Interest Group on Knowledge Discovery and data mining and the website isckdd.org.
So I was a little bit concerned that this morning speaker said I don't know what is data mining.
They wanted to give a short definition in a very briefly, it is making sense of data.
A little bit longer definition.

It's really the art and science, finding useful patterns and data where the art is not just in the artistic sent, but in the practical sense like the Carpenter or the plumber may have practical art how to do this, and sometimes you need both science grounded and math and statistics and some practical issues.
And finally, for the academics we there is this definition that.
With summer pork and myself included in the book.
Back in 96, data mining is the nontrivial process of identifying valid novel potentially useful and ultimately understandable patterns in data.
So, just in case if you manage are so other friends say they don't quite know what is data mining, you have different ways to reply.
So what does CKD D do?
Well, I think it is I mentioned.
Is the professional society for data mining and Knowledge Discovery and our main activity obviously is organizing this conference.
Once a year we also Co sponsor.
With the other six, another conference called Wisdom Web Search and data mining.
I'll talk a little bit about this later with support in cooperation.

Several other conferences, including such conferences as Recommendation System, Rexis and Social Predictive Behavior, and several other activities will publish a newsmagazine, CKD Exploracion's, and the editor Sikidy Expressions will be.
Talking about it a little bit short later.
With.
Sponsor annual awards their Award for Innovation which would like to think as the Noble price in data mining.
Their word for service for extraordinary service, to the community.
And we would like to expand the scope of the service award to include not just service to sikidy but service to the community at large.
So, for example, somebody who develops a great.
Algorithm that uses knowledge discovery to identify cure for cancer or detect fraud or help reduce climate change certainly would be very good candidate for this award.
We started a couple of years ago, which I think is very successful program for awards for outstanding dissertation.
And by the way, all this award also come with cash prizes.
Other activities that we do, we we have published data mining curriculum.
So professors that want to have suggested programs, for example with undergraduate and Masters in data mining can find it on our website.
We've organized the webcast that went for some period of time and currently they in hibernation due to lack of interest.
We're experimenting this year with KDD social network.
This is the crowd wine site.
I'll ask you about it in a moment.
And in general, the goal of cichlid is a professional societies to facilitate research and data mining, improve industry, academia interaction and support the data mining community.
So.

Little bit of historical retrospective followed by report from Jerry can about TCD, D. CKD exploracion's, and then I'll turn over to the GNU CKDD chair and he'll talk about his plans.
And where is the next.
K did you going to be?
In terms of communicating news on KDD and data mining, I also published a website KD Nuggets.
Nashville how many of you actually subscribe to KD Nuggets?
So maybe like 1/4 so it comes out twice a week and that's a free subscription and hope you will subscribe and get all the latest news and data mining and knowledge discovery.
And you can also follow my Twitter feed.
So.

At 20 years after Oras Dimaro to Vantana Prayer so 1989, I organized the first workshop on Knowledge Discovery and data mining, which was in Detroit, and I guess 1989 we could consider the KDD Stone Age.
This is the.
Kind of their very primitive icon that I created manually showing extraction from numbers to some network in somebody's head.
The numbers on the workshop cover page were supposed to represent KDD.
I don't think anybody besides me actually knew about it.

The important research direction, as I looked at the KDD 89 proceedings were domain knowledge dealing with uncertainty, efficiency, incremental approaches and interactive system and in some way this topics is still with us.
Although we have many kind of look at them at newer and larger levels.

Now median largest database.
2009 according to recent Katie Nuggets police.
10 terabytes.

Why don't we just make it an open conference?
So was the first conference and knowledge discovery and data mining in Montreal, Canada.

Anna 9910 years ago CK DD was created with a lot of help from one Kim who was at that time chair of Sigmodon knew how to navigate the ACM bureaucracy and he served as a chair from 99 2005 and I was elected as a chair in 2005 and serving as a chair, antilla, tonight.
So the modern age of KDD today.
I went to the web and I counted and this year there are 2525 conferences with data mining KDD in it's in their name that's not counting workshop, just the conferences course.
Besides our conference there is IEEE I CDM that's rotates US Asian Europe.
There is Siam data mining conference mainly in the US.
There are regional conferences.
ECMLPKDD national conferences in Australia, China and France.
Vendor conferences from SAS, SPSS, sulfured.
Now there is new commercial conference turn predictive analytics world.
So many many thousands of pay.
Chris and then you research areas.
Social network is one of this area text mining.
More build geographical sensor data.
Privacy the new research area that appeared recently.
Image multimedia mining.
And many of this applications have becoming diploid and embedded, although not necessarily under the name data mining.
I think I consider the biggest success of data mining in a search engines like Google.
All the data mining is really a web.
Mining is a small part of what they do, but a very essential part.
You know finding the relevant sets of pages.

Sigmoid has a huge decline from about 3000 to about 1800 and CGR is also in about the stadia level so.

This year actually the we for first time we had an increase in student membership.
